39.heading: Timidity.
39.title: "The Difficulties of Adventure" p. 24-31 in Insatiable
39.author: Fernando Caretta ; translated by Laura Petrarca (Seattle, WA : Eros Comix, 1998).
notes: Summary: An editor is tired of his reporter's lukewarm stories, and demands something exciting. Jones, the timid reporter, gets a lead on a Mafia boss and heads for Morocco. He is almost killed, then seduced, then kidnapped, then saved by the Foreign Legion and the F.B.I., and exchanged for a K.G.B. spy. The editor doesn't believe him.

40.heading: Timidity.
40.title: Othello
40.author: Satomi Ikezawa ; translated and adapted by William Flanagan ; lettered by Michaelis/Carpelis Design.
notes: "First published in Japan in 2003 by Kodansha."

"Yaya's high school friends haven't been very nice. They call her "Yaya the cry-ya! Yaya the misfi-ya!" but no matter how badly they act, Yaya is just too naive and trusting to believe the worst of them. Hard rocking, butt-kicking Nana is just the girl to grab hold of Yaya's timid demeanor and turn it upside down. Nana exposes Yaya's "friends" as slimeballs, doles out punishment, and does it all with style. Can there be anything that terminally shy Yaya and hyperconfident Nana have in common? Well, for one thing, they're the same person."

notes: Summary (from OCLC): The story of Simba, the lion cub, and all the other animals of Pride Rock, including Mufasa, Scar, the hyenas, as well as Timon and Pumbaa.
"Originally published in Denmark by Egmont Books, Copenhagen, in 1994."

133.heading: Timon.
133.title: Far from the Pride Lands
133.author: adapted by Jane Schonberger ; illustrated by Al White Studios.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): After Simba leaves the Pride Lands he meets up with Timon and Pumbaa and adopts their "no worries" life style until he decides to return and fight for the kingdom.

134.heading: Timon.
134.title: The Lion King.
134.author: [No author]

publication info.publisher: Walt Disney Home Entertainment : Buena Vista Home Entertainment

notes: Originally released as a motion picture in 1994.

Summary (from OCLC): Simba begins life as an honored prince, son of the powerful King Mufasa. The cub's happy childhood turns tragic when his evil uncle Scar murders Mufasa and drives Simba away from the kingdom. In exile, the young lion befriends the comically bumbling pair of Pumbaa the warthog and Timon the meerkat and lives a carefree jungle life. As he approaches adulthood, however, he is visited by the spirit of his father, who instructs him to defeat the nefarious Scar and reclaim his rightful throne.
Library has book only intended to accompany a set of 2 DVDs.

135.heading: Timon.
135.title: The Lion King [videorecording]
135.author: Walt Disney Pictures ; produced by Don Hahn ; screenplay by Irene Mecchi and Jonathan Roberts and Linda Woolverton ; directed by Roger Allers and Rob Minkoff.

publication info.publisher: Walt Disney Home Entertainment : Buena Vista Home Entertainment

notes: Originally released as a motion picture in 1994.

Summary (from OCLC): Simba begins life as an honored prince, son of the powerful King Mufasa. The cub's happy childhood turns tragic when his evil uncle Scar murders Mufasa and drives Simba away from the kingdom. In exile, the young lion befriends the comically bumbling pair of Pumbaa the warthog and Timon the meerkat and lives a carefree jungle life. As he approaches adulthood, however, he is visited by the spirit of his father, who instructs him to defeat the nefarious Scar and reclaim his rightful throne.

Toby is a bear, Choppe is a fake doctor.

157.title: "Timothy the Talking Terrier"
157.author: [No author]
157.series: Oswald) 8 p. in New Funnies, no. 97
notes: Summary: Prof. Harsh plots to capture Timothy. He sneaks a potion that causes laryngitis into his water at the radio station, and Timothy can't do the benefit broadcast for the "maladjusted offspring of the forgotten white-collar worker." Then Harsh disguises himself as a doctor, makes Tim sign a paper, and takes him away for an operation.

167.title: 9 Timbres pour le 9e Art : Hommage : 10e Anniversaire du Centre Belge de la Bande Dessinée
167.author: textes, Jean Auquier.

publication info.publisher: Centre Belge de la Bande Dessinée

notes: Cancelled sheet of 9 comics-related postage stamps mounted on p. 5. Text includes illustrated articles on each of 8 strips and authors so honored: Corentin by Paul Cuvelier, Jerry Spring by Jijé, Gil Jourdan by Maurice Tillieux, La Patrouille des Castors by MiTacq, Hassan et Kaddour by Jacques Laudy, Buck Danny by Vic Hubinon, Tif et Tondu by Fernand Dineur, Timour by Sirius, and one stamp honoring the 10th anniversary of the Centre.
